results.title: To authorize the expansion of an existing hydroelectric project, and for other purposes.
results.short_title: To authorize the expansion of an existing hydroelectric project, and for other purposes.
results.latest_major_action: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 159.
results.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the House on June 2, 2017. The summary of that version is repeated here.) (Sec.1)This bill authorizes the licensee for the Terror Lake Hydroelectric Project in Kodiak Island, Alaska, to occupy not more than 20 acres of federal land to construct, operate, and maintain the Upper Hidden Basin Diversion Expansion without further authorization under the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act or from the Department of the Interior.
results.summary_short: (This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the House on June 2, 2017. The summary of that version is repeated here.) (Sec.1)This bill authorizes the licensee for the Terror Lake Hydroelectric Project in Kodiak Island, Alaska, to occupy not more than 20 acres of federal land to construct, operate, and maintain the Upper Hidden Basin Diversion Expansion without further authorization under the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act or from the Department of the Interior.

actions.description: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 159.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 424 - 1 (Roll no. 330). (text: CR H5204)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H5218-5219)

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 220.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H5204-5205)
Mr. Cook moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 101.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 115-154.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.
Subcommittee on Water, Power and Oceans Discharged.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Lands.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water, Power and Oceans.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

votes.question: On Motion to Suspend the Rules and Pass, as Amended
